suncertify.fields
Class CurrencyField

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.fields.CurrencyField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Field>, Field
public final class CurrencyField
extends java.lang.Object
implements Field

An immutable currency database field. The value stored is the number of cents, which allows us to use a non-floating point number to avoid loss of precision.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

CurrencyField

public CurrencyField(java.lang.String prefix,
                     long cents,
                     int centsPerDollar)
Construct a new integer field with the given value.

Parameters:
prefix - the currency prefix, e.g. "US$". May be null.
cents - the number of cents
centsPerDollar - the number of cents in each dollar

public java.lang.String getPrefix()
Get the prefix for this type of currency.

Returns:
the String prefix, e.g. "US$"

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Get a string describing the field. The string contains the prefix and the value in cents.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:

compareTo

public int compareTo(Field other)
Compare this currency field to another currency field.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Field>
Parameters:
other - the Field to be compared. Must be a CurrencyField
Returns:
the lexicographic comparison of the currency prefixes. If the prefixes are the same, the currency values will be compared and the return value will be -1 if this object's value is less than the other object's value, 1 if this object's value is greater than the other object's value, or 0 if both values are the same.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if other is not a CurrencyField
